events.name: Indorse Roadmap, 0xcert (assets into Non Fungible Tokens), ERC721 lead author
events.description: 7pm - 7.45pm: Indorse - roadmap Gaurang Torvekar, the CEO of Indorse will speak about the Skills validation platform being developed by the company and currently in use by more than 25,000 users. Gaurang will talk about how Indorse is changing the lives of developers all across the world by helping them validate their skills and reach their full potential with the use of blockchain technology. Indorse recently finished their re-branding with ServicePlan, a leading advertising agency based in Germany. Indorse has been featured in Coindesk, Forbes, Inc, International Business Times. ---- 7.45pm - 8.30pm: 0xcert and ERC721 0xcert is an open source protocol that translates one-of-a-kind digital or real-world assets into non-fungible tokens (NFTs) - unique proof of ownership available on the blockchain. Developers can build dapps (decentralized apps) on top of it, while end users can use their solutions to prove the existence, authenticity, authorship or ownership of their assets (such as collectibles, university degrees, identity/KYC, in-game items or a house), making them available and safely stored in their wallets. Team:William Entriken, Adviser at 0xcert, lead author of the ERC 721: https://www.linkedin.com/in/fulldecent/ William is a remarkable thinker and a technological leader, an Ethereum blockchain developer and the lead author of ERC-721, which is a technological standard interface protocol for non-fungible tokens, also known as deeds. He is a passionate computer science professional who is helping to bring technology products to market. He has experience in business planning and acquisitions, and is active in researching several computer science topics. As the non-fungibles has been identified as the new driver behind the Blockchain revolution, first example of this are everyone’s favourite Crypto Kitties, his fame is rising rapidly and has gained on GitHub, home of more than 20 million developers from all over the world, a cult status. Jure Zih, 0xcert Co-Founder and CEO: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jurezih/ At heart, Jure is an entrepreneur, an innovator who is always looking for the latest solutions, with an exceptional capacity for fast and abstract learning and adaptation. Even as a child he was interested in new technologies and how things work. While pursuing a dual major in electrical engineering and economics, he worked as a digital editor in the launching and editing of Slovenia’s first interactive online newspaper, and later during his studies he founded and sold his first successful company, which specialized in the development of online stores and the optimization of online sales channels. Immediately after completing his degree he cut his teeth as a digital researcher and strategist. His path took him to the US, to Databox, first mobile app for biz intelligence, where he worked for several years in the field of business intelligence as director of Marketing and won numerous respectul awards for their work. Shortly after his thirtieth birthday, Jure took a new and decisive step in his business life, when he left his job at a successful multinational, where he was in charge of growth, in order to pursue an idea. Today, Jure is the co-founder and CEO of 0xcert.
events.location: Paypal Innovation Lab, 5 Temasek Boulevard #07-01, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore, 038985

events.name: PyData Meetup July 2018
events.description: Agenda • 6:45pm - 7:00pm Networking • 7:00pm - 7:15pm - Innovation Culture at Wego by Tien Nguyen• 7:15pm - 8:15pm - ELT: Breaking away from the tradition by Ahsan Dar• 8:15pm - 9:15pm - cron is so yesterday: scheduling Python tasks with Airflow by Daniel Poon--- Synopsis: 1. Innovation Culture at Wego:Giving an overview of Wego's architecture and the culture of innovation. 2. Breaking away from the traditionETL has been the long industry standard to manage your data, In this session we will be speaking through how we used ELT over ETL and efficiently developed a model supporting both stream and batch pipelines where software engineers assist data scientists. 3. cron is so yesterday: scheduling Python tasks with Airflowcron has been the go-to solution for scheduling tasks on remote Linux systems. In this session we will be speaking on the motivation for moving task scheduling to Airflow, as well as deep diving into the infrastructure designed for reliable task deployment and scheduling. We'll be demonstrating an end-to-end deployment and running of a sample ML task on this infrastructure.--- Bio: 1. Tien NguyenTien is a seasoned technical leader, motivated to harness technology to improve people’s lives. He is passionate about crafting innovative technology products that make a meaningful difference to travellers. As the CTO of Wego, he works towards nurturing and managing a talented engineering team. 2. Ahsan DarAhsan Dar is a Lead Engineer at Wego heading the team managing SRE, Data pipeline and Analytics API. Programming, travel and sports are the constants in life. 3. Daniel PoonDaniel is a Lead Engineer at Wego with the Content, Tools and Services team. He focuses on designing sane, user-friendly workflows to enhance the capabilities of internal stakeholders. Updates Join us on Facebook and Twitter https://www.facebook.com/groups/pydatasg/https://www.twitter.com/pydatasg Sponsors   Group Sponsor
events.location: LEVEL3, Mapletree Business City, 20 Pasir Panjang Road, East Wing 03-22/24 Singapore, 117439

events.name: HackerNest Singapore July Tech Social
events.description: >>>> HackerNest Tech Socials (http://hackernest.com/cities/) are a fun, relaxed way to connect with your local tech community. Atmosphere: chill, friendly, unpretentious, agenda-free (no sales pitch), and brimming with Ultra Smart People. Follow us on Twitter (http://twitter.com/hackernest) and Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/hackernest/), like us on Facebook (http://facebook.com/hackernest), hi-5 us in person! The typical Tech Social agenda: Folks arrive, grab drinks, socialize >> quick announcements, thank sponsors >> back to chatting >> head home, exhilarated from great conversations! **** HackerNest Tech Socials are Entry by Donation - $5 to $10 is suggested. If a cash donation is too restrictive, no problem - just email your Tech Social Organizers and sign up to volunteer that night. **** SPONSOR: Sponsors make this growing movement possible, so we treasure and build deep, long-term relationships with the companies that endorse us. Please email [masked] to chat about ways to connect with the HackerNest community! VENUE: Found. is a network of innovation studios where ambitious entrepreneurs and corporates find coaching, expertise, and partners to create future-ready solutions. We are a community of over 2,500 members and alumni, and have supported more than 75 corporates in developing their innovation agendas. We also became Google for Entrepreneurs’ first Southeast Asian partner in 2017. For more information, visit www.found.us We're on the lookout for easy to access offices with space that can fit our audience (standing-room only). Please email [masked] if you’d like to host a Tech Social! COMMUNITY PARTNERS: Email [masked] to promote these cool community events and get yours on our radar. About Us: HackerNest (http://hackernest.com/) builds strong, supportive local tech communities around the world. We run unpretentious tech and innovation events that improve humanity and overall economic prosperity. Check out this video to see what Tech Socials are like: https://youtu.be/9wG2TpzEm5o Want to volunteer at our HackerNest Tech Socials? Visit http://about.hackernest.com/volunteer/ for more information and to apply!

events.name: IoT Security Research
events.description: Come and learn about the findings from F5 Lab’s extensive original research into mapping IoT Thingbots such as Mirai, Persirai and Reaper. The research also tracks which countries appear to be attacking which other countries. Lots of rich discussion around IoT DDOS, the new IoT security legislation and some promising long term protocols that may fix all of this. F&B will be provided with thanks to F5! Speaker: David HolmesBased in Asia Pacific, David Holmes is the Global Security Evangelist for F5 Networks. In this role, Holmes is spokesman, researcher and evangelist for F5’s threat intelligence division, with an emphasis on cryptography, distributed denial of service attacks, and the Internet of Things. He speaks at conferences such as RSA, InfoSec and Gartner Data Center. Holmes authors white papers on security topics such as global cryptography trends and modern DDoS threat spectrum. He has also written for industry magazines such as the SCMagazine and Network World. These days,he writes regularly about vulnerabilities, technical solutions and the security industry for SecurityWeek.com and F5 Labs. He joined F5 Networks in 2001, and, as a Principal Software Engineer, where he designed many of the system and core security features. Holmes has 20 years of experience in security and product engineering. Prior to F5, Holmes was a Vice President of Engineering at Dvorak Development (in Boulder, CO) and a Senior Software Engineer (Security) at CyberSafe, Inc. Holmes majored in Computer Science and Engineering Physics at the University of Colorado at Boulder. For public speaking, Holmes has a Competent Communicator award from Toastmasters International and other public speaking awards.
events.location: NUSS Guild House Suntec City, 3, Temasek Boulevard..TOWER 5 #02-401, Singapore
